keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By AMY QIN and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: Amy Qin reported from Beijing, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea. Yufan Huang contributed research.

lead_paragraph: In the wake of a Korean military agreement with the United States, several events in China featuring the South’s music and television stars have been canceled.

headline.print_headline: After Missile Defense Deal, Some Doors Shut on South Korean Stars
headline.main: South Korean Missile Defense Deal Appears to Sour China’s Taste for K-Pop

snippet: In the wake of a Korean military agreement with the United States, several events in China featuring the South’s music and television stars have been canceled....
abstract: Memo from China; China cancels several music and television events featuring Korean pop stars, raising fears that government is retaliating against South Korea's allowance of American missile-defense system on its soil via entertainment industry.
